sentences.english: The troops will be pulled out in two stages.
He may have hoped that news just arrived from Poland might oblige the Swedes to withdraw.
sentences.chinese: 他可能還希望過從波蘭來的消息能迫使瑞典人撤軍。

sentences.english: Ru-song li threat XuanZu if not recall yoo sung-ryong, Ming army withdrawal.
sentences.chinese: 李如松威脅宣祖如果不罷免柳成龍，明軍就撤軍。

sentences.english: We’re starting this drawdown from a position of strength.
sentences.chinese: 我們是從強勢地位開始這次撤軍的。

sentences.english: Among other things, the deal calls for coalition forces to withdraw from Iraq in three years.
sentences.chinese: 這項協議包括要求盟軍部隊在三年內從伊拉克撤軍。

sentences.english: Moscow has pulled a fast one on us by breaking its word on troop withdrawals.
sentences.chinese: 莫斯科耍了我們一票，撤軍的事不認賬了。

sentences.english: Ethiopia says it is committed to the withdrawal plans.
sentences.chinese: 埃塞俄比亞表示決心執行撤軍計劃。

sentences.english: White House Spokesman Gordon Johndroe says that should not take several days.
sentences.chinese: 白宮發言人約翰德羅說，撤軍不需要花費好多天時間。

sentences.english: He has promised his supporters that he is going to pull out as quickly as possible.
sentences.chinese: 他向支持者承諾將盡快從速從伊拉克撤軍。

sentences.english: But he says hurrying up withdrawals could undermine the effort.
sentences.chinese: 但是匆忙的撤軍會破壞已獲得的成就。

sentences.english: On north Korea after Song Yingchang court announced the Ming army withdrawal.
sentences.chinese: 之後宋應昌對朝鮮朝廷宣佈明軍撤軍。

sentences.english: Michael Oquendo says the pullout is a bad idea.
sentences.chinese: 邁克爾Oquendo說，撤軍是一個壞主意。

sentences.english: The Afghan war may yet end in an ignominious retreat.
sentences.chinese: 然而，阿富汗戰爭或許會在一場不光彩的撤軍中結束。

sentences.english: Excellent balance of properties between terminal pullout and impact resistance.
sentences.chinese: 出色的平衡性能的終端撤軍和耐衝擊性。

sentences.english: He has promised his supporters that he will pull out as soon and as quickly as possible.
sentences.chinese: 他向支持者承諾將盡快從速從伊拉克撤軍。

definition: to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
commander-in-chief, the equivalent of king in Chinese chess
to take turns/to work by roster
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
to open up land for cultivation/to garrison troops to open up land
armed enemy of the nation/enemy of the Emperor/fig. championship challenger/contender opposing champion in sporting contest
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
